Some remarks:

Using nested functions is a bad habit. You can replace that with a simple for-loop in a generator comprehension or map.
In your code you have defined your function twice. The first definition is never used, so you can remove it.
The if n % 2 == 0 else n * fact(n - 1) is a Python specific syntax. In other languages you would have to write (n % 2 == 0)? n * fact(n - 1) : n * fact(n - 1).
You don't need to use range(1, n) for the same reason.
If you don't have any intention to use this code in Python 3, you can simplify your code using xrange(1, n) instead of range(1, n), since in Python 2 range will return an actual list.
